body_html:
@ekelsen I've been looking for GPU implementation of tf.unique, and it seems one could implement non-stable variant with hash tables using tf operations like scatter_nd_update and gather_nd. However, I don't know if these operations run on GPU?

Furthermore, a unique operation that is applied to each item of a minibatch separately complicates things, as scatter works with tf.Variable, but map_fn will produce tensor outputs.

Furthermore, a unique operation that is applied to each item of a minibatch separately complicates things, as scatter works with tf.Variable, but map_fn will produce tensor outputs.
body:
@ekelsen I've been looking for GPU implementation of tf.unique, and it seems one could implement non-stable variant with hash tables using tf operations like scatter_nd_update and gather_nd. However, I don't know if these operations run on GPU?

Furthermore, a unique operation that is applied to each item of a minibatch separately complicates things, as scatter works with tf.Variable, but map_fn will produce tensor outputs.
